title: Evangelicals Mobilize Voters, But GOP Candidates Less Vocally Supportive
teaser: Republican candidates haven't been emphasizing their message to religious conservatives this year. But polls suggest evangelical Christians could be their most important block of voters come Election Day. David Greene talks to Pastor Bill Tvedt of the Jubilee Family Church in Oskaloosa, Iowa.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
